ADVANCED_ADVANCED_TEXT: In Other you can change the check interval, so that the query is slower to react to commands and executes them somewhat delayed. This is usefull if the TS3MusicBot can not whitelist on the TS3-Server and you want to use it in Query mode. It is  also possible to select a different font or date format and activate the function last seen.
ADVANCED_ADVERTISING_TEXT: In Advertising it is possible either to send a message server-wide or only in a particular channel. A time interval can be set.
ADVANCED_AUTOMOVE_TEXT: With Automove, a server group will be moved to a channel when entering the server (as long as the users do not specify a different default channel for itself).
ADVANCED_AWAY_TEXT: Here users can be automatically moved in a channel if they set themself a away status. In addition, there is the possibility that the user from the switched channel can be moved back again.
ADVANCED_BAD_CHANNELNAME_TEXT:
With Bad Channel name certain words in the name of the Channel can be filtered out, so that Channels get deleted for unsuitable name.
The following link gives some information about regular expressions:
http://java.sun.com/j2se/1.5.0/docs/api/java/util/regex/Pattern.html
Important: If you are not sure, you can test your regular expressions on the following page:
http://regexp-evaluator.de/evaluator/
ADVANCED_BAD_NICKNAME_TEXT:
With Bad Username certain words in the name of the user can be filtered out, so that users are kicked for unsuitable nickname.
The following link gives some information about regular expressions:
http://java.sun.com/j2se/1.5.0/docs/api/java/util/regex/Pattern.html
Important: If you are not sure, you can test your regular expressions on the following page:
http://regexp-evaluator.de/evaluator/
ADVANCED_IDLE_TEXT: With this function it is possible to move/kick idle users out of there Channel if they doesnt speak and/or write for some time.
ADVANCED_MUTE_TEXT: The mute function move users after a certain time or directly if they deactivate microphone or headphones or have an absent microphone or headphone. Optional with a move back function.
ADVANCED_RECORD_TEXT: With Record you can prevent recording with the built-in recording function of TeamSpeak for the user. By either kicking or moving.
ADVANCED_SERVERGROUP_NOTIFY_TEXT: Server join notify informs a certain server group is about connecting users to the server.
ADVANCED_SERVERGROUP_PROTECTION_TEXT: The server group protection prevents that certain groups may be set by others but even if a user lacks a group it is automatically added to it again and again.
ADVANCED_WELCOME_MESSAGE_TEXT: With the welcome message TeamSpeak users or groups get a message or get poked if they are join the Server. You can also set a robot voice welcome message.
COMMANDLIST_ADDMUSIC_TEXT: Add a single song to queue.
COMMANDLIST_ADDYOUTUBE_TEXT: Add a youtube, soundcloud or other link to queue.
COMMANDLIST_BOTHELP_TEXT: Displays a list of all commands.
COMMANDLIST_CHANNELCOMMANDER_TEXT: Toggle channel commander for the client (the client will need the rights to become channelcommander).
COMMANDLIST_DOWNLOADMEDIA_TEXT: Load a media file down and stores it in the music folder.
COMMANDLIST_DOWNLOADRADIO_TEXT: Load a radio playlist down and stores it in the radio folder.
COMMANDLIST_HISTORY_TEXT: Shows a list from the last 20 played files.
COMMANDLIST_MUSICLIST_TEXT: Displays a list of all media files.
COMMANDLIST_PLAYALL_TEXT: Plays all media files in the music folder.
COMMANDLIST_PLAYLIST_TEXT: Displays a list of all playlists.
COMMANDLIST_RADIOLIST_TEXT: Displays a list of all radio stations.
COMMANDLIST_RANDOMRADIO_TEXT: Plays a random radio station from shoutcast.com.
COMMANDLIST_REMOVEAVATAR_TEXT: Removes the current set client avatar image.
COMMANDLIST_REPEAT_TEXT: Repeat the current playing music file/folder or youtube/soundcloud playlist.
COMMANDLIST_SAY_TEXT: The TS3MusicBot will say "your message". The default language can be set in the TS3MusicBot settings. The abbreviation for English is 'en'.
COMMANDLIST_SETAVATAR_TEXT: Set the given image from url as client avatar.
COMMANDLIST_VOLUME_TEXT: Set the volume to a desired value.
COMMANDLIST_YOUTUBEDOWNLOAD_TEXT: Loading and converts a Youtube video down and stores it as .mp3 file in the 'music/Youtube downloads' folder.
COMMANDLIST_YOUTUBE_TEXT: Begins playing a Youtube video (or other links -> see here).
COMMANDLIST_YTGOTO_TEXT: Jump to the Youtube video from a currently playing playlist with the position NUMBER.
PLAYER_CONTROLS_REPEAT_TEXT: Repeat current playing song or playlist
SETTINGS_AVATAR_MODE_0_TEXT: If avatar operating mode is set to 0, you can upload an avatar picture here which the client should display.
SETTINGS_AVATAR_MODE_1_TEXT: If the avatar operating mode is set to 1, a dynamic avatar will be generated (200x300 pixels) which displays the cover and the current playing track and also the last 4 played tracks.
SETTINGS_AVATAR_MODE_2_TEXT: If the avatar operating mode is set to 2, a dynamic avatar will be generated (300x300 pixels) which displays the cover and the current playing track and also the last 4 played tracks.
SETTINGS_AVATAR_TEXT: Here you can set the client avatar picture. You can also setup dynamic avatar, which will set an avatar showing the current playback title with cover and the history.
SETTINGS_IDENTITY_IMPORT_TEXT:
To use the TS3MusicBot with a higher security level generate a new identity with your ts3 client and export it as a .ini file. Next upload it here. To use the imported identity restart the TS3MusicBot.

Set avatar instructions:
To set an avatar use your client and connect with the created identity to your server and set your avatar. Then export the identity as an .ini file and upload it here. Make sure you don't use the identity after this or the TS3MusicBot can't connect.
SETTINGS_POWER_TS3MUSICBOT_STOPPED_TEXT: Your TS3MusicBot is now shut down.
SETTINGS_SKIN_TEXT: Use the skin browser to download new skins. The skin can always be changed here.
SETTINGS_SOFT_RESTART_TEXT: If something goes wrong you can perform a soft-restart here. A soft-restart means, the main process stays alive. If something freezed and a soft restart does not help please stop and start the TS3MusicBot process.
SETTINGS_TEAMSPEAK_SERVER_TEXT: Here you can save a teamspeak server password if required or setup your query connection if query mode is enabled.
SETTINGS_TS3MUSICBOT_TEXT:
Here you can set TS3MusicBot settings like name, start volume, autostart, autostart repeat, robot voice and Youtube-proxy.
The following features are only available if query mode is active: Welcome message or sound, autostop if channel empty, channel notifications or radio notifications.
SETTINGS_USER_PERMISSIONS_TEXT: Here you can set the permissions for the webinterface user login and also the chat users. Checked features are enabled for the user, unchecked features are disabled.
SHOUTCAST_DOWNLOAD_FORM_TEXT: Download radio station start file into radio folder:
TEXT_CREATE_PLAYLIST_NOTE: Note: If a playlist with the same name already exist then the selected tracks will be added to this list.
tooltip_advertising_channel_id: If mode 2 selected, set channel id to write advertising message into it.
tooltip_advertising_enable: Enable advertising, 0 = disable, 1 = send to virtual server, 2 = send to channel.
tooltip_advertising_file: A list of advertising messages (one line per message). The bot write this messages in the order from left to right and start from left again. Typical BBCode like in Teamspeak 3 Client possible. You can use #n for a new line inside a message.
tooltip_automove_enable: Enable auto move, 0 = disable, 1 = enable. If enabled, this function will move connecting clients of a specified server group to a specified channel. This function ignores clients with an own default channel set.
tooltip_automove_file: Chat message for the auto move function. Typical BBCode like in Teamspeak 3 Client possible.
tooltip_automove_message_mode: Select the message mode, how the clients should get the message. poke, chat or none are valid values!
tooltip_automove_servergroup_list:
This is the list of server groups (one line per entry), which will be moved to a specified channel. Starting with the server group id, followed by a comma, and ends with the channel id.

An example:
1,340
2,120
tooltip_autostart: Set a autostart music file, folder, a radio playlist or a youtube link (and all other supported links). Examples: 'music/folder1/' plays a music folder. 'music/folder1/file.mp3' plays a music file. 'radio/station.pls' starts a radio station. 'http://youtubelink' starts a youtube link or playlist. You can also save 'playall' or 'playallrandom'.
tooltip_autostop_channel_empty: Stops playing if no users are in the same channel as the bot. 1 = enable, 0 = disable
tooltip_avatar_embed_code: With this HTML code you can display the current avatar graphic on a homepage.
tooltip_away_channel_list: A comma separated list (without spaces) of channel ids. Depends on the given mode, this channels can be ignored or only this channels will be checked!
tooltip_away_channel_list_mode: Select one of the two modes for the channel list. ignore = The selected channels will be ignored. only = Only the selected channels will be checked.
tooltip_away_check_enable: Enable away mover, 0 = disable, 1 = enable, 2 = enable with move back. This feature will move the client as soon as away status is set for longer than X seconds, specified below.
tooltip_away_file: Away Mover message, the client get this message as chat message. You can use the following keywords, which will be replaced: %AWAY_CHANNEL_NAME% - This will be replaced with the channel name of the 'Move channel ID'. Typical BBCode like in Teamspeak 3 Client possible.
tooltip_away_group_list: A comma separated list (without spaces) of server group ids. Depends on the given mode, this server groups can be ignored or only this server groups will be checked!
tooltip_away_group_list_mode: Select one of the two modes for the server group list. ignore = The selected server groups will be ignored. only = Only the selected server groups will be checked.
tooltip_away_message_mode: Select the message mode, how the client should get the message. poke, chat or none are valid values!
tooltip_away_move_channel_id: Channel id to move away clients into it.
tooltip_away_move_delay: Idle time in seconds after the client with away status will be moved to the channel. Has between 0 and 1000 seconds.
tooltip_badchannelname_channel_list: A comma separated list (without spaces) of channel ids. This channels will be ignored!
tooltip_badchannelname_check_enable: Enable bad channel name check, 0 = disable, 1 = enable. This feature will force delete every channel which match one of the bad channel name rules.
tooltip_badchannelname_file: Set bad channel name rules here (one line per rule). Use regular expressions for the rules. This rules will be used case-insensitive. The following link give you some informations about regular expressions in java: http://java.sun.com/j2se/1.5.0/docs/api/java/util/regex/Pattern.html Important: If you are not sure, test your regular expressions on the following page: http://www.rubular.com or http://regexp-evaluator.de/evaluator/ Or the bot may delete all channels, if you do something wrong!
tooltip_badnickname_add_complain: Add complain entry to the user, 0 = No, 1 = Yes.
tooltip_badnickname_check_enable: Enable bad nickname check, 0 = disable, 1 = enable. This feature will kick every client which match one of the bad nickname rules.
tooltip_badnickname_file: Set kick message for using a bad nickname. Typical BBCode like in Teamspeak 3 Client.
tooltip_badnickname_group_list: A comma separated list (without spaces) of server group ids. Depends on the given mode, this server groups can be ignored or only this server groups will be checked!
tooltip_badnickname_group_list_mode: Select one of the two modes for the server group list. ignore = The selected server groups will be ignored. only = Only the selected server groups will be checked.
tooltip_badnickname_rules_string: Set bad nickname rules here (one line per rule). Use regular expressions for the rules. This rules will be used case-insensitive. The following link give you some informations about regular expressions in java: http://java.sun.com/j2se/1.5.0/docs/api/java/util/regex/Pattern.html Important: If you are not sure, test your regular expressions on the following page: http://www.rubular.com or http://regexp-evaluator.de/evaluator/ Or the bot may kick all people, if you do something wrong!
tooltip_bot_admin_list: A list of unique user ids (each user id in a new line), which should be able to use TS3MusicBot chat admin commands (including !restart). The unique user ids looks like this: 4dJNvcdQbGc5LDFoGkuaN1j9o7w=
tooltip_bot_admin_server_group_id: A comma separated list (without spaces) of server group IDs who can send chat commands to the TS3MusicBot. Its the same right as 'Admin identities'.
tooltip_bot_channel_id: Set the join channel id on startup. The TS3MusicBot will join into this channel after connecting. If not wanted set: -1.
tooltip_bot_channel_password: If the join channel is password protected set the password here. If not leave this field blank.
tooltip_bot_check_interval: Query check every X seconds, default is 1. Values between 1 and 30 are allowed. If slow mode is activated, 3 is the lowest possible value.
tooltip_bot_clientdblist_cache: This enables the client database list cache. This cache is needed for commands like !lastseen. 1 = enable, 0 = disable
tooltip_bot_connect_forever: Should the TS3MusicBot try to connect forever if the teamspeak server or the TS3MusicBot is offline? 0 = disable, 1 = enable.
tooltip_bot_date_pattern: Change the date pattern, which will be used to format a date in chat functions and welcome message. To get help how to make such a pattern, look here: http://java.sun.com/j2se/1.5.0/docs/api/java/text/SimpleDateFormat.html
tooltip_bot_messages_encoding: A different encoding of the messages. Default is UTF-8 which should be good for all EU and US languages. Change this only if you know what you are doing! For english or german language you can also use the encoding ISO-8859-1 A list of all valid ones: http://java.sun.com/j2se/1.5.0/docs/guide/intl/encoding.doc.html
tooltip_bot_server_query_name: Server Query name, this will be displayed as name of the query connection.
tooltip_bot_slowmode: Activates the slow mode of the TS3MusicBot, the TS3MusicBot connects slower to the server and disables some TS3MusicBot query features to reduce the amount of needed commands. This feature may allow you to use the TS3MusicBot in query mode without whitelist the TS3MusicBot IP address. Slow mode disables the bad channel name check, welcome message, client database cache and do not allow the bot check interval to be lower than 3 seconds. 0 = disable, 1 = enable.
tooltip_channelcommander: If enabled, the TS3MusicBot client will be channel commander after startup (the TS3MusicBot client needs the permission to be channel commander). 1 = enable, 2 = disable.
tooltip_channel_notifications_enable: Enable or disable all channel messages. 1 = enable, 0 = disable
tooltip_command_lastseen: Allow !lastseen command for all clients? 1 = Yes, 0 = No.
tooltip_default_welcomemessage_enable: Enable default welcome message, 0 = disable, 1 = enable. This welcome message, if enabled, will be used for all other groups than specified for 'Groups'. If 'Group message enable' is disabled, then this will be used for all clients in all groups.
tooltip_default_welcomemessage_message_m: Select the message mode, how the client should get the message. poke or chat are valid values!
tooltip_dynamic_avatar_mode:
Set the avatar operating mode.
0 = dynamic avatar is deactivated. It is possible to set an avatar manually.
1 = dynamic avatar with size 200x300px.
2 = dynamic avatar with size 300x300px.
tooltip_idle_channel_list: A comma separated list (without spaces) of channel ids. Depends on the given mode, this channels can be ignored or only this channels will be checked.
tooltip_idle_channel_list_mode: Select one of the two modes for the channel list. ignore = The selected channels will be ignored. only = Only the selected channels will be checked.
tooltip_idle_check_enable: Enable idle check, 0 = disable, 1 = kick, 2 = move. This feature will move or kick an idle client.
tooltip_idle_file:
Idle message, the client get this message as kick reason (mode 1) or chat message (mode 2). You can use the following keywords, which will be replaced:
%IDLE_MAX_TIME% - Replaced with max idle time.
%IDLE_CHANNEL_NAME% - If mode 2 selected, this will be replaced with the channel name of the 'Move channel ID'.

Typical BBCode like in Teamspeak 3 Client possible.
tooltip_idle_group_list: A comma separated list (without spaces) of server group ids. Depends on the given mode, this server groups can be ignored or only this server groups will be checked.
tooltip_idle_group_list_mode: Select one of the two modes for the server group list. ignore = The selected server groups will be ignored. only = Only the selected server groups will be checked.
tooltip_idle_max_time: Set the max idle time in minutes. If mode 1 selected, the client will be kicked after being idle for this time. If mode 2 selected, the client will be moved to 'idle move channel id' after being idle for this time.
tooltip_idle_message_mode: Select the message mode, how the client should get the message (useless if kick is enabled). poke, chat or none are valid values.
tooltip_idle_min_clients: A minimum client count to activate idle check (query and normal clients counted together). If less clients online, idle check does nothing.
tooltip_idle_move_channel_id: If mode 2 selected, set channel id to move idle clients into it.
tooltip_idle_second_max_time: If mode 2 selected, set the max idle time in minutes to kick someone. Has to be greater than 'idle max time' or -1 to disable this feature.
tooltip_idle_second_message:
If mode 2 selected, set the kick reason for being idle longer than idle second max time. You can use the following keywords, which will be replaced:
%IDLE_MAX_TIME% - Replaced with max idle time.
%IDLE_SECOND_MAX_TIME% - This will be replaced with the second idle max time.

Typical BBCode like in teamspeak 3 client possible.
tooltip_idle_warn_message:
Idle warning message, the client get this message as chat message. You can use the following keywords, which will be replaced:
%IDLE_WARN_TIME% - Replaced with idle warn time.
%IDLE_MAX_TIME% - Replaced with max idle time.
%IDLE_CHANNEL_NAME% - If mode 2 selected, this will be replaced with the channel name of the 'idle move channel id'.
tooltip_idle_warn_message_mode: Select the message mode, how the client should get the message. poke or chat are valid values.
tooltip_idle_warn_time: Set the idle warn time in minutes or set -1 to disable this feature. The idle warn time has to be smaller than the 'max idle time'.
tooltip_mute_channel_list: A comma separated list (without spaces) of channel ids. Depends on the given mode, this channels can be ignored or only this channels will be checked!
tooltip_mute_channel_list_mode: Select one of the two modes for the channel list. ignore = The selected channels will be ignored. only = Only the selected channels will be checked.
tooltip_mute_check_enable: Enable mute mover, 0 = disable, 1 = enable, 2 = enable with move back. This feature will move the client as soon as the specified mute status is set for longer than X seconds, specified below.
tooltip_mute_file: Mute Mover message, the client get this message as chat message. You can use the following keywords, which will be replaced: %MUTE_CHANNEL_NAME% - This will be replaced with the channel name of the 'Move channel ID'. Typical BBCode like in Teamspeak 3 Client possible.
tooltip_mute_group_list: A comma separated list (without spaces) of server group ids. Depends on the given mode, this server groups can be ignored or only this server groups will be checked!
tooltip_mute_group_list_mode: Select one of the two modes for the server group list. ignore = The selected server groups will be ignored. only = Only the selected server groups will be checked.
tooltip_mute_message_mode: Select the message mode, how the client should get the message. poke, chat or none are valid values!
tooltip_mute_move_channel_id: Channel id to move muted clients into it.
tooltip_mute_move_delay: Idle time in seconds after the client with a specified mute status will be moved to the channel. Has between 0 and 1000 seconds!
tooltip_mute_move_headphone: Enable move if headphone is muted, 0 = disable, 1 = enable.
tooltip_mute_move_headphone_hardware: Enable move if headphone hardware is disabled, 0 = disable, 1 = enable.
tooltip_mute_move_microphone: Enable move if microphone is muted, 0 = disable, 1 = enable.
tooltip_mute_move_microphone_hardware: Enable move if microphone hardware is disabled, 0 = disable, 1 = enable. This also happen if someone is speaking in another TS3 client server tab.
tooltip_radio_admin_list: A list of unique user ids (each user id in a new line), which should be able to use TS3MusicBot chat music commands. The unique user ids looks like this: 4dJNvcdQbGc5LDFoGkuaN1j9o7w=
tooltip_radio_admin_server_group_id: A comma separated list (without spaces) of server group IDs who can send chat commands to the TS3MusicBot. Its the same right as 'User identities'.
tooltip_record_add_complain: Add complain entry to the user, 0 = No, 1 = Yes.
tooltip_record_channel_list: A comma separated list (without spaces) of channel ids. Depends on the given mode, this channels can be ignored or only this channels will be checked.
tooltip_record_channel_list_mode: Select one of the two modes for the channel list. ignore = The selected channels will be ignored. only = Only the selected channels will be checked.
tooltip_record_check_enable: Choose a record check mode: 0 = disable, 1 = kick, 2 = move. This feature will move or kick a recording client (of course only the record function of the teamspeak client is detected).
tooltip_record_file: Set a record message. On both modes the client should see the message. If using mode 2 for moving, you can use %RECORD_CHANNEL_NAME% in the message, which will be replaced with the channel name (of the record move channel id). Typical BBCode like in Teamspeak 3 Client possible.
tooltip_record_group_list: A comma separated list (without spaces) of server group ids. Depends on the given mode, this server groups can be ignored or only this server groups will be checked.
tooltip_record_group_list_mode: Select one of the two modes for the server group list. ignore = The selected server groups will be ignored. only = Only the selected server groups will be checked.
tooltip_record_message_mode: Select the message mode, how the client should get the message (useless if kick is enabled). poke, chat or none are valid values.
tooltip_record_move_channel_id: If mode 2 is selected, set the channel id to move recording clients into it.
tooltip_repeat: Enables the repeat function in combination with the autostart function. 1 = enable, 0 = disable
tooltip_send_radio_infos: Enable or disable the channel messages for radio station informations (song/album informations, advertasing, ...). 1 = enable, 0 = disable
tooltip_servergroupnotify_channel_list: A comma separated list (without spaces) of channel ids. Depends on the given mode, target clients in this channels can be ignored or only clients in this channels receive the notify message!
tooltip_servergroupnotify_channel_list_m: Select one of the two modes for the channel list. ignore = Clients in the selected channels will be ignored. only = Only clients in the selected channels receive the notify message.
tooltip_servergroupnotify_enable: Enable server group notify, 0 = disable, 1 = enable. If enabled, this function will notify specified server groups about joining clients in a specified server group.
tooltip_servergroupnotify_file: Server Group Notify message, specified clients get this message as chat or poke message. You can use the following keywords, which will be replaced: %SERVER_GROUP_ID% - Server Group ID. %SERVER_GROUP_NAME% - Server Group Name. %CLIENT_NAME% - Client Name. %CLIENT_DBID% - Client Database ID. %CLIENT_UNIQUEID% - Client Unique ID. Typical BBCode like in Teamspeak 3 Client possible.
tooltip_servergroupnotify_groups: A comma separated list (without spaces) of server group ids, which should be watched on joining.
tooltip_servergroupnotify_grouptargets: A comma separated list (without spaces) of server group ids, which should be notified about joining clients.
tooltip_servergroupnotify_message_mode: Select the message mode, how the clients should get the message. poke or chat are valid values!
tooltip_servergroupprotection_add_compla: Add complain entry to the user, 0 = No, 1 = Yes. This would only add a complaint, if the bot has to remove a server group.
tooltip_servergroupprotection_add_missin: If a client is listed in 'Allowed clients' and miss a server group, they get added to the server group. 0 = disable, 1 = enable.
tooltip_servergroupprotection_enable: Enable server group protection, 0 = disable, 1 = enable. If enabled, this function will check all server groups from clients on the server, which are currently online. If a client use a protected server group and is not on the list of the bot, it will be removed from the server group.
tooltip_servergroupprotection_file: Kick or chat message for the server group protection. You can use the following keywords, which will be replaced: %SERVER_GROUP_ID% - Replaced with the server group id. %SERVER_GROUP_NAME% - Replaced with the server group name. Typical BBCode like in Teamspeak 3 Client possible.
tooltip_servergroupprotection_groups: A comma separated list (without spaces) of server group ids, which should be protected.
tooltip_servergroupprotection_identities: This is the list of allowed clients in the protected server groups (one line per entry). Starting with the server group id, followed by a comma, and ends with the unique id of the client. If a client is member of two protected groups, make two lines with the same unique id, but different server group id. An example (please remove this example after you understand it):
tooltip_servergroupprotection_kick: Enable this to kick every client which using a protected server group and are not on the list of the bot, 0 = disable, 1 = enable.
tooltip_servergroupprotection_message_mo: Select the message mode, how the client should get the message (useless if kick is enabled). poke, chat or none are valid values!
tooltip_ts3_musicbot_name: The name of the TS3MusicBot client that you will on the teamspeak server.
tooltip_ts3_server_password: Teamspeak 3 server password (if required), if your server is password protected.
tooltip_ts3_server_query_login: Teamspeak 3 server query login. You can create a query login with your client under Tools->ServerQuery Login.
tooltip_ts3_server_query_password: Teamspeak 3 server query password. You can create a query login with your client under Tools->ServerQuery Login.
tooltip_ts3_virtualserver_id: Optional: Teamspeak 3 virtual server ID or -1 to use the teamspeak server port which will be used to select your server (default is: -1).
tooltip_welcomemessage_enable: You can set another welcome message for specified server groups, 0 = disable, 1 = enable.
tooltip_welcomemessage_file: Set default welcome message. Typical BBCode like in Teamspeak 3 Client. You can use the following keywords, which will be replaced: %CLIENT_NICKNAME% - Nickname of the client %CLIENT_VERSION% - Client version %CLIENT_PLATFORM% - Client platform (Windows, Linux, ...) %CLIENT_IP% - Client IP address, bot needs permission b_client_remoteaddress_view for this! %CLIENT_CREATED% - Date and time of the first connection of the client %CLIENT_TOTALCONNECTIONS% - Total connection count of the client %CLIENT_MONTH_BYTES_UPLOADED% - Uploaded data in current month (filetransfer and avatar) %CLIENT_MONTH_BYTES_DOWNLOADED% - Downloaded data in current month (filetransfer and avatar) %CLIENT_TOTAL_BYTES_UPLOADED% - Uploaded data all times (filetransfer and avatar) %CLIENT_TOTAL_BYTES_DOWNLOADED% - Downloaded data all times (filetransfer and avatar) %SERVER_NAME% - Server name %SERVER_PLATFORM% - Server platform (Windows, Linux, ...) %SERVER_VERSION% - Server version %SERVER_CREATED_DATE% - Server created date %SERVER_UPTIME% - Server uptime in days, hours, ... %SERVER_UPTIME_DATE% - Server uptime as date %SERVER_UPLOAD_QUOTA% - Server upload quota %SERVER_DOWNLOAD_QUOTA% - Server download quota %SERVER_MONTH_BYTES_UPLOADED% - Uploaded data in current month (filetransfer and avatar) %SERVER_MONTH_BYTES_DOWNLOADED% - Downloaded data in current month (filetransfer and avatar) %SERVER_TOTAL_BYTES_UPLOADED% - Uploaded data all times (filetransfer and avatar) %SERVER_TOTAL_BYTES_DOWNLOADED% - Downloaded data all times (filetransfer and avatar) %SERVER_MAX_CLIENTS% - Server max clients (slots) %SERVER_RESERVED_SLOTS% - Server reserved slots %SERVER_CHANNEL_COUNT% - Current channel count %SERVER_CLIENT_COUNT% - Current client count %SERVER_CLIENT_CONNECTIONS_COUNT% - Server client connections count Most server informations are not updated instantly, they will be updated every 10 minutes. This welcome message, if enabled, will be used for all other groups than specified for welcomemessage_groups. If welcomemessage_enable is disabled, then this will be used for all clients in all groups.
tooltip_welcomemessage_groups: A comma separated list (without spaces) of server group ids, which should get this welcome message.
tooltip_welcomemessage_message: Set welcome message. Same keywords like at the default welcome message. Typical BBCode like in Teamspeak 3 Client. This welcome message will be used for specified server groups you defined at 'Groups'.
tooltip_welcomemessage_message_mode: Select the message mode, how the client should get the message. poke or chat are valid values!
tooltip_welcomesound_enable: Enable welcome sound (can be a music file or a robot voice message), 0 = disable, 1 = enable.
tooltip_welcome_sound_music_file: The welcome sound file, it has to be saved in the music folder, eg. welcome.mp3
tooltip_welcome_sound_say_language: Sets the default language set for the robot voice. Supported languages: af, sq, ar, hy, ca, zh-CN, zh-TW, hr, cs, da, nl, en, eo, fi, fr, de, el, ht, hi, hu, is, id, it, ja, ko, la, lv, mk, no, pl, pt, ro, ru, sr, sk, es, sw, sv, ta, th, tr, vi, cy.
tooltip_welcome_sound_say_message: Define a message which the TS3MusicBot is reading with robotic voice after a new client joined the server. Same keywords like at the default welcome message.
tooltip_youtube_proxy: If a proxy is set, youtube and other links will played through a http proxy. Needed if youtube is not working (maybe a firewall) or not not allowed in your country. Insert a http proxy in this format: http://IP:PORT
COMMANDLIST_SEARCH_TEXT: Search in the music, radio and playlist folder with the given search string. Example: !search remix (will find all files with the word 'remix' in the name).
tooltip_sendclickablelinks: If the function 'clickable start-links in chat' is activated, the chat outputs for musik, radio, playlist and search can be started with a click on it (!music, !radio, !playlist, !search xxxx).
COMMANDLIST_PLAYALLRANDOM_TEXT: Plays all media files in the music folder in random order if nothing is playing. If a youtube playlist or a own music playlist is running, the list gets shuffled and restarted in a random order.
ADVANCED_CHANNEL_JOIN_NOTIFY_TEXT: Get notified with a poke or chat message if users with specific server groups are joining specific channels on the server.
tooltip_channel_join_notify_channel_list: A comma separated list (without spaces) of channel ids. Depends on the given mode, target clients in this channels can be ignored or only clients in this channels get monitored!
Select one of the two modes for the channel list. ignore = Clients in the selected channels will be ignored. only = Only clients in the selected channels will be monitored.
tooltip_channel_join_notify_enable: Enable channel join notification, 0 = disable, 1 = enable. If enabled, this function will notify specified server groups about joining clients to specific channels in a specified server group.
tooltip_channel_join_notify_file:
Channel join notification message, specified target clients get this message as chat or poke message. You can use the following keywords, which will be replaced:
%SERVER_GROUP_ID% - Server group ID.
%SERVER_GROUP_NAME% - Server group name.
%CLIENT_NAME% - Client name.
%CHANNEL_NAME% - Channel name.
Typical BBCode like in Teamspeak 3 Client possible.
tooltip_channel_join_notify_groups: A comma separated list (without spaces) of server group ids, which should be watched on joining to the specific channels.
tooltip_channel_join_notify_grouptargets: A comma separated list (without spaces) of server group ids, which should be notified about joining clients to the channels.
tooltip_channel_join_notify_message_mode: Select the message mode, how the clients should get the message. poke or chat are valid values!
tooltip_discord_default_text_channel: Here you can set a different discord text channel where the TS3MusicBot listen and writes to.
COMMANDLIST_WHISPER_TEXT: If the TS3MusicBot runs in whisper mode this command activates or deactivates the playback for the user.
tooltip_whispermode: Enable or disable whisper mode. 0 = disable, 1 = enable. In whisper mode TS3MusicBot can stream to users directly (channel playback is off) with the teamspeak whisper function. See !whisper command.
